children.value: G6 encapsulates a set of interaction behaviors. Now we add simple some behaviors to
: hover node, click node, click edge, drag cavas, zoom canvas. The expected result:
interaction behaviors. You can enable these behaviors conveniently:
: enable the canvas to be dragged;
: enable the canvas to be zoomed;

Mode is a mechanism for state management in G6. One mode is a set of several Behaviors. You can assemble different Behaviors to modes. The concept of mode is too complicated to understand for the beginners of G6. You do not need to know it well in this tutorial. For more information, please refer to
is a mechanism of item state in G6. You can set different item styles for different states. When the state of an item is changed, the style will be updated automatically. For example, set the state
, and set the node style of the state
with thicker stroke. This style will take effect when the state
. There will be a specific in the Usage part.

properties.ariaLabel: built in behaviors drag and zoom permalink

children.value: when instantiating the graph, the corresponding built-in Behaviors will be enabled:
// Allow users to drag canvas, zoom canvas, and drag nodes
The code above uses the Behaviors by assigning their types. Besides, you can also configure the parameters for them, e.g. the sensitivity of zooming, max/min zoom ratio. Refer to
object above defines a set of interaction modes of the graph, where
is the default mode, which includes
. You can add more modes with their Behaviors into

properties.ariaLabel: hover and click to change styles permalink

children.value: Hover and Click to Change Styles

Sometimes, the styles of the items interacted by users should be updated to make the response. As shown in figure 1, the styles are changed when user hovers the node, clicks the node, and clicks the edge. It is achieved by
mechanism. In other word, whether the item is clicked or hovered can be described as some states. You are able to set the styles for different states by two steps:
Step 1: Set the styles for different states;
Step 2: Listen to the relative events and switch the states.
for nodes and edges respectively when instantiating a Graph.
The color of the node is changed when mouse hover it;
The stroke of the node gets thicker and darker when user clicks it;
The edge become blue when user clicks it.
The following code sets the styles for nodes in the state of
), and the styles for edges in the state of
// The set of styles of nodes in different states
// The node style when the state 'hover' is true
// The node style when the state 'click' is true
// The edge styles in different states
// The edge style when the state 'click' is true

properties.ariaLabel: listen to the events and switch the states permalink

children.value: Listen to the Events and Switch the States
The listeners in G6 are mounted on the instance of Graph.
is the instance of G6.Graph in the following code.
/ ... all the events are collected in:

// Set the state 'hover' of the item to be false
// Swich the 'click' state of the node to be false
// Set the state 'click' of the item to be true
// Swich the 'click' state of the edge to be false
// Set the state 'click' of the item to be true
// Default properties for all the nodes
// Default properties for all the edges
// The node styles in different states
// The node style when the state 'hover' is true
// The node style when the state 'click' is true
// The edge styles in different states
// The edge style when the state 'click' is true
// Set the state 'hover' of the item to be true
// Set the state 'hover' of the item to be false
// Swich the 'click' state of the node to be false
// Set the state 'click' of the item to be true
// Swich the 'click' state of the edge to be false
// Set the state 'click' of the item to be true
